revised_title: Boiling Point and Composition in Organic Compounds: A Historical Overview
tldr: This article discusses the relationship between the boiling point and chemical composition of organic compounds, specifically focusing on the regularities observed in homologous series. The author presents a historical overview of the research and findings, including the influence of elemental differences on boiling points and the accuracy of boiling point determinations. The article also highlights the importance of understanding these relationships in the field of organic chemistry.
